bow: any new moms out there that were not in zombie mode while caring for newborn and can share their life tricks edit ladies thank you so much got plenty of ideas now on how to plan for the first few weeks my fear about halved hear crickets in this thread if you re not exclusively breastfeeding sometimes if the husband takes night shift you can sleep all night always tend to wake up anyway since light sleeper just hold out for months and then it gets better my only newborn trick is that anyone who wanted to come visit had to bring coffee with them and if they asked if we needed anything else always asked for fruit veggie tray bedsharing is how got any sleep any tips on bedsharing want to do it but there huge campaign against it where live let people help let people in had my mom and mil both staying with us for the first few months of course there were issues but being in zombie mode was not one of those we also had lot of friends over on and off sometimes they helped around the house but mostly gave me chance to have some conversation and freshen my head which was priceless also used to go for small 20 30 minute walk as soon as my doc said ok was stuck home all day and just the small change in scenery was relief everyday even if you do want to have people that can come over just ask for help next time somebody offers just say that home cooked meals would be awesome for few days you could outsource laundry maybe there are some services where they come and pick your clothes and return washed ironed and folded clothes back or get cleaning person come and take away some load from you there are always coupons on groupon and such sites for these another thing that helped me was taking lots and lots of pics of the little one anytime you are feeling low just browsing thru the pics on your phone makes things brighter research how to do it safely they make co sleepers that help with this do leave baby on the edge of the bed do cosleep if you ve been drinking or have taken sleep medication make sure others in the bed are aware of the babies location keep the bed open like crib no heavy blankets or pillows cosleeping saved my sanity when had my son it gets less scary once they re big enough to reposition themselves the baby swing dear god get baby swing this had wonderful sleep bed sharing she would wake up and would just pop boob in her mouth if got uncomfortable or needed deeper sleep would just pop her in to the pack and play next to the bed until she woke up again think this depends hugely on your baby personality my son was like clockwork as newborn hungry at exactly the three hour mark napped at the same time predictably every day do know if had anything to do with this or if it was just the way he was but here the rundown he slept in moses basket bassinet right next to my side of the bed for the first months breastfed so when he woke up change him first then feed him one important thing with night feedings was to keep it very quiet and as dark as possible had tiny nightlight which gave off enough glow to see what was doing no talking singing in the night just quiet feeding and back to sleep some people recommend bedsharing but we did do that also he spit up lot so would breastfeed in bed thought breastfeeding in bed would be convenient but just ended up with spit up all over my pillow now the stereotypical advice sleep when your baby sleeps actually do it do do chores or go online or shower or whatever else it is you feel you have to do you have to sleep napped with my baby every afternoon do it every day so now you ask when did shower if not when the baby was sleeping bought clear shower curtain so could see him put him in bouncy seat in the bathroom shower ever day you ll feel better get sling ergo bjorn whatever kind of carrier works for you did lot of chores and grocery shopping with the baby in the ergo during the newborn stage was definitely tired from the interrupted sleep but still felt generally ok about the amount of rest was getting do overdo the coffee if you re taking in lot of caffeine once you do have time to rest it will be harder to go to sleep even though your body is tired controversial but bedsharing when mine was 2mos old people would remark how tired we must be and remember thinking actually feel ok should point out researched it heavily and was exclusively breastfeeding unless there weight problems do wake the baby at night or ever mean leave them in wet diaper do force them to take both boobs or finish bottle wake up feed sleep ve left them in poop diapers for bit too if they re asleep it does immediately cause rashes if babe wants to be held find carrier and use it the more sleep baby gets the less miserable everyone else is you have given such excellent advice have found that good self care is key in not feeling like zombie all the time you feel refreshed and that helps in taking better care of your baby and your surroundings would also suggest doing one nice thing for yourself every day this should be simple things like putting on face mask nice smelling lotion watching your favorite show and relaxing whatever you enjoy doing and yes definitely accept all the help you can get hang in there mama that what wanted to hear that is possible to feel ok was breastfeeding and my husband took weeks of vacation so we did shifts at night he take from to 1ish then bring the baby downstairs to me where do to 8ish sleeping on different floors sucked but it was the only way was waking up every hour because of baby noise even on my husband shift did feel too bad was able to get hours sleep in row there are number of guides on safe cosleeping bedsharing here one http cosleeping nd edu safe co sleeping guidelines for me major plus was that had pretty big baby from the start and he had very strong legs too so he was really capable of kicking me when he wanted something like to be reajusted and he was hard to squish now that he gotten even bigger ve strapped his crib on as side car so he on the official crib mattress and we have lot more space but he can still reach my boobs easily have occasionally even woken up because he latched on boba wrap and coffee shower every morning when you get up even if it just for minutes and drink water before having coffee the fourth trimester is real 5s that little crank pot so they think they are back in the glorious womb when they get to fussing throw down 5s and kiddo we ll be great first swaddle them so tight trust me they love it the need it but they are just fighting you to practice for toddlerhood second turn them flat and sideways into you third jiggle them gently to make it they say shake but you know fourth shhhhhhhhh shhhhhh them until you re blue in the face wait until they take breath and jump in there hard with the shhhhhhhhing fifth suck on something pacifier boob thumb cat whatever this is an amazing trick wish learned earlier also if they are crying so hard they look like they will pass out blow in their face it makes them take breath some kids can scream until the pass out literally could have written this post but one difference bottle fed on the hour mark he wake and had bottles with the water in add the pre measured formula from special container mix it feed put him back in his sidecar bassinet can not overstate that his sleep is very important this is when they grow and yours is just as important nap twice day and use his third for some cleaning time did the same thing with the shower put him in bouncy seat shower with him in there if he happened to cry it felt like the end of the world but honestly you can see he safe and crying is ok you can get the soap out and stay safe before consoling him also did not babywear as he hated it from day one had all sorts of carriers but best laid plans just like breastfeeding good luck it hardcore short stage our nurse told us this as we were leaving the hospital after my first it was godsend swing time was the only time got anything done also check the music for annoyingness same for me am soooo much more well rested now that we bedshare because do have to fully wake up to nurse read this book sleeping with your baby parents guide to cosleeping https www amazon com sleeping your baby parents cosleeping dp 1930775342 felt fantastic after giving birth to both of my kids was so ecstatic to feel normal again after months of feeling sick and huge and uncomfortable we also co slept and breastfed exclusively which was grateful for as it helped me to feel in control of an out of control situation do what works for you and do give anyone the opportunity to tell you otherwise we cosleep get approximately the same amount of sleep did prepregnancy and way more than did in the third trimester and the snuggles are out of this world if you have really colicky baby or experience purple crying it totally okay to pop some head phones in and listen to something while you re trying to comfort the baby made me less stressed and was able to better comfort him after realized there was literally nothing could do to stop him from crying that just needed to be there and hold him my youngest is going on months we have bassinet at the bottom of our bed where he sleeps at night get up and make him bottle and feed him with very minimal light on just the light in my closet and lay him back down no diaper changes and keep him swaddles he normally downs his bottle and is back out shortly after in the early days when he was waking up more at night my husband and would switch off on turns sleep from 9pm 1am and if then when the baby woke up after that get up with him it helped having long stretch of sleep and thankfully my year old sleeps til about 8am so could still get some rest after 1am agree obviously every family is different but if your family is malicious and you do absolutely hate being around them having people around is sanity saver feel like see parents being pushed to stay alone with baby to bond and know for sure that would make me crazy no visitors for weeks would have climbed the walls just had my second child and it lot easier this time take your prenatal and supplement with iron vitamin and fish oil take fresh air walks with your baby at least once day caffeinate in the morning it the only thing that helps with the lack of sleep did caffeinate for my first but my morning cup is so important take care of yourself it makes you better provider controversially these are things did differently with my second child bottle feed no nursing or pumping disposable diapers no judging other mothers ultimately whatever your choices are you got to own it it ok to not enjoy the newborn phase it will pass and things get so much better so agree with this it was just us in the amp amp room and first few hours with the baby the grandparents came once we were settled in the recovery room and then we had so many of our close friends come over all thru out the day to meet and welcome the baby it was such special day and am happy we could share it with our loved ones no body stayed for too long but gave us so many happy memories am glad that we did it this way so simple but sleep when the baby sleeps do tidy up do do the dishes lay down and have nap did this every single time in the first few months with baby number one and can say did not feel like zombie was in zombie mode the first weeks but now week 10 am beyond zombie working kids that do sleep through the night just does offer anything else so lots of coffee happens first weeks my husband did school drop off for the oldest two so stayed in bed until 8am or so that was the biggest help for night feeds keep it dark had as few lights as possible so did get fully woken either red light over the changing table fed lo in the living room to avoid waking up my husband as others have said think it also depends on baby personality mine was overall very easy honestly felt great right from the start the only thing that gave me trouble was breastfeeding and also he would nap anywhere except on someone but for that there babywearing sure my house looked like bomb hit it for lot of that time but was sleeping reasonably well and happy and formula ended up working out great because my husband could take night duty and then when the baby woke up me and him snuck out and left dad to sleep for few more hours in retrospect wish had gone out more because he was great out and it way more of hassle now that he does fit in his bucket seat he still usually in great mood when we take him out though that one of the tricks to my particular baby at least haha damn saving this one for next time that brilliant newborns wake for little while then go back to sleep did get out of bed until 11 12 most days baby did notice the difference did just cause he woke up at 6am does mean you have to get up then was lucky enough to have my mom with us for the first two months and was ok with pumping some are so our nighttime schedule was like 9pm pump and go to bed 10 husband on baby duty would feed from bottle if necessary then put in fridge me on baby duty would feed from boob as needed mom on baby duty would use bottle from fridge my daughter was snacker 3oz bottle would last for all the hours was out during the day she was on me constantly until weeks got the my brest friend pillow could actually nurse her at my desk while working worked from home starting at weeks my mom and husband cut all my food so could eat one handed it was exhausting but knew it was forever and it was what she needed so accommodated her best could it was lot easier because got several stretches of uninterrupted sleep double layer bassinet and change table mattress protecter sheet mattress protector sheet and some kind of towel double layer for the change table in the event of late night puke or blowout just rip the top layer off and get that baby back to sleep they stop pooping at night after about weeks at that point stop changing them just straight on the boob burp swaddle and back in the bassinet if you put them down and they thrash around like worm wait until it turns into actual crying before picking up to help settle the wiggling 90 of the time will end in sleeping white noise not only does it help baby sleep through your noise at night it will help you sleep through theirs babies are noisy sleepers do respond to every squeak and fart stock up on one handed food liked oat bars and bananas do worry about the following things how frequently you bath the baby once week is fine if you should be reading to your baby not unless you want to if your baby is stimulated enough should you be playing with your baby more they find staring into space stimulating for the first 10 weeks or so there really no need to do more unless you are enjoying it if you have had the baby yet make up as many freezer meals as you can fit in your freezer made enough that did have to cook dinner for over month made chicken and wild rice casseroles shepherds pie pot pies big and minis crockpot pulled pork lamb stew breakfast sandwiches breakfast burritos homemade hot pockets chicken curry and french toast casserole it took me almost month to do all of that but do big batch of rice one day cook off couple costco packs of chicken one day make the sauce and shred the cheese one day and assemble another day everything was stored in aluminum pans or plastic cups could toss so did have to do dishes wasteful know but life saver when you do have time to shower daily if you ve already had the baby congrats trader joe has decent freezer meals and premodern salads you can utilize my nugget is only weeks is it too late for me to implement this lol if you can take at least one nap day it helps with lack of sleep and feeling dead share feedings and diaper changes with someone so it is not all on you if someone comes over and asks to help let them talk to adults and get out of the house when you can these two things alone have kept me sane removed actually really enjoyed the first few months sure life was different but was in no way zombie give all the credit to bed sharing felt connected to my lo and got plenty of sleep from the get go he slept from 12 to am with feeds now at months he is about to with no wakeups but dream feeds off and on all night we used snuza halo and all the safety recommendations truly enjoy it like others said accept help my mum stayed over and my husband took time off my mum took care of the house and my husband cooked both helped with the baby take shower every day you will bleed and leak milk in the beginning and feel disgusting did even if my son was awake hand him off to my mum and shower after my mum left and my husband went back to work put him in bouncy seat in the bathroom have the baby next to you at night and breastfeed lying down if had to get up take long time to fall asleep again after learned to feed him lying down sleep was easier attached his cot to my side of the bed so if fell asleep while he fed he was still safe go out as soon as you re able go for walk out of the house fresh air does wonders babywearing newborns want to be close all of the time so wear them before got comfortable wearing my son felt trapped by him because my arms were always busy after started babywearing doing things around the house and even going out became easier mum groups they get bad press but they can be great go to bumps and babies breastfeeding support babywearing groups library song time whatever you have access to and find like minded mums with babies of similar age to yours if possible start this network at antenatal classes or at least while still pregnant especially if it your first baby having non judgemental group of women going through the same challenges at the same time is wonderful for peace of mind and for having safe space to vent have activities during maternity leave assuming it longer than weeks when you re not getting full night sleep the days just run into each other so going to mum groups or other activities divides up your days had bumps and babies on mondays library on wednesdays baby cinema and coffee with my antenatal group on thursdays just do expect to be exactly on time for anything congrats on the baby we re talking about perhaps second and nursing exclusively and cloth diapering are definitely on the chopping block was not in turbo zombie mode was tired yes but overall was overwhelmed with anything in the fourth trimester tips lots of family support just past the point that you can handle and then take break from family for bit my husband also took two months off of work and did all the housework for the first six weeks totally depends on the baby my daughter hated that thing and it was requested back to be given to another newborn and we did get another for our son because there was no point used the baby carrier with him and never missed the swing personally slept so deeply after giving birth that co sleeping would have been needlessly dangerous there campaign for reason hint babies keep dying source same campaign in my town for that very reason and sure lots of people do it my sister did with all of her kids and they re fine for me it was risk was willing to take like any other risk you have to be fully aware of the pros cons and be willing to live with what happens bedsharing have to return to work after weeks and need to be well rested to be able to function can not swaddle and nurse this baby 4x night so she sleeps next to me instead actually not completely broken this time around my kiddo preferred one of those sling chairs that bounces rocks bit but same idea and effect do do it if you re obese have any sleep disorder count it out if you snore unless you ve been evaluated you drank *anything* or took any drugs that day you like sheets and blankets you re excessively tired on any given day you or your partner move around lot honestly was counted out on everything but drugs alcohol so just put the baby into the stroller bassinet attachment and parked him next to my bed bonus if he was asleep could wheel him around the house with me to keep my eye on him or move him away from the blender someone was about to use etc lol goes to show people are very different hate having visitors and always have our first ones came to see the baby at our house when he was months old and was anxious as hell totally agree the swing made my son hyperventilate biggest waste of 50 no matter what take shower every day no matter what make it happen naps and walks and stuff are great when possible but shower is must one of those parents who suggests that my husband and did that and it was lovely we stocked our freezer with homemade meals hired housekeeper and just holed up for couple of weeks we certainly had visitors but they came by for couple hours at time which was perfect it really depends on the couple it just felt right for us to have that level of privacy and we were not in zombie mode at all now however with my 2nd on the way have no problem with my mil coming to stay with us to help from day one or even before sidecar open sided crib thing attached to your bed is what made me feel safest also used portable sleeper thing similar to this http www target com the first years close secure portable infant sleeper 530166 ref=tgt adv xs000000 amp afid=google pla df amp cpng=pla baby+shopping amp adgroup=sc baby amp lid=700000001170770pgs amp network=g amp device=c amp location=9023739 amp gclid=cj0keqia4jncbrdq5be3nkcphpwbeiqajwn1bvdblomlqak0q8zsaiwgk6w7rlr ors5gq3j6y 9aeyaamav8p8haq amp gclsrc=aw ds the first week or so until my husband and were always aware of the baby even while sleeping you can make one with pool noodle stuck in pillowcase if cost is an issue with my second child almost went insane with the sleep deprivation and constantly terrified was going to fall down the stairs to my death doing groggy night runs to the nursery my next pregnancy was twins that is when broke down and learned to nurse lying down cosleep and nurse while sleeping feared literally would not survive it otherwise and it was life changing whatever the other challenges of twins were and they were many was more well rested than when only had one edit would like to point out also that doubt anyone would roll over on her baby while the baby was attached to breast as mine often were was so zombied had to download an app to keep track of which boob had fed from last it helped keep track of when to take my meds and when to give the drop too it nice theory but then would have had food clothes taken showers and my house would ve been even more messy know yourself stress with mess so allowed myself to clean or organize for 30 mins to an hour day and then felt sane and did hate my husband or anyone random who walked through the door yes this ve started sleep training my son and to tune out his crying downloaded book from audible onto my phone best thing ever my second baby was so much fussier than my first baby baby one was exhausting but pleasant and made me think that baby two would be even easier now that was so experienced but baby two basically only did four things eat poop cry and sleep not much sleep though little bits of sleep surrounded by long periods of nursing rocking and carrying around crying baby and singing to him on very bad days had to wear him in the carrier and take him on long walks just to get him to fall asleep did the 5ss with the first baby it worked wonderfully and never really understood colic baby number one rarely cried baby number two screamed through all swaddling hated being held sideways and refused to suck on anything but the breast it turns out that like you said sometimes you cant do anything about it but be there learned not to feel stressed just because of crying and to patiently keep plugging along it can be difficult but things got better gradually when he was able to play with toys it helped keep his attention he was never good sleeper so as he has grown and needed fewer naps naturally his mood has improved he is 16 months old now and just starting to feel little in control of my life and by the time they re this age there no telltale sign of wether or not they were colicky newborn still pretty tired though found that with my method of parenting the exhaustion lasts until we stop nursing because do inhibit the night time feeds find some white noise that is loopable for your phone spotify has bunch so does amazon music turn it on turn it up and put it by them it does always work but for me it seems to work most of the time at least between about 6pm and 7am even my toddler gets white noise all night long to help him sleep rain sounds vacuum sounds whatever you can tolerate and works there was wah wah one that vaguely sounded like heartbeat that my firstborn would always settle down for bed share do do it until baby is at the two or three month mark newborns are just too small with our first hubby slept on the couch for long time because he was afraid of smooshing the baby with number two he sleeps with his back to us and baby sleeps in the middle not by the edge baby 16 months actually prefers snuggling his daddy when he is nursing and hubby complains often of being kicked all night no regular pillows by baby if you want pillow use small one that just fits under your head you lay on your side and make letter with your body with baby protected inside the curve this way baby has access to the breast and you will feel immediately if your hubby is accidentally rolling over too close you can put the other hand on baby to make sure they are safe you have to make sure the blanket stays off of baby having his and hers blankets and swaddling the baby or using wearable blanket is best your blanket stays below your waist they say that you should bed share if you drink smoke take medications that affect your ability to wake up or are overly tired that goes for both parents and is probably the reason they are campaigning against it by you everyone has to consciously have baby safety in mind and be in good health and unaffected by any substances for me bed sharing allows me to maximize the amount of sleep get while allowing baby to nurse as often as they want it means do have to get out of bed multiple times night also enjoy sleeping next to my babies and know that they will be small for such short period of time and someday they will be too big to sleep with mommy want to savor every moment also sleep better with baby next to me when number two outgrew his pack play switched to small mattress on the floor am able to lay next to him while put him to sleep and for the first part of the night we have the bed to ourselves when baby eventually wakes up either go get him or he climbs in himself using the mattress instead of crib requires vigilance you have to go to baby as soon as they wake up to keep them out of trouble or they might unload all your drawers dump out the wipes warmer or wreak general havoc would have liked to try co sleeper but we have lower ikea beds on the other hand keep some pillows on the floor around my side of the bed and would worry if he accidentally fell out from such low height onto the pillows now that he good size and to wrap it up with how this all started my first baby was about three months old and was absolutely exhausted we were spending vacation at my grandmas house and she has really tall beds compared to what we re used to was nursing baby back to sleep in the middle of the night which used to sit up and stay awake for because that what you re supposed to do then suddenly woke up and was laying down and baby was right there on the edge of the bed ready to fall any time had no memory of even laying down and putting her there it really frightened me and decided it would be safer just to plan to have her in bed than to do it on accident and not do it safely also decided after switching to bed sharing that trying to stay awake at night while baby nurses is unnatural biologically speaking of course baby number two has such firm latch that ca sleep when he nursing so there that but at least do have to wake up all the way good luck and sure you ll find something that works perfectly for your family suppose did create lot of mess alone with baby so there was much mess to bother me eating usually happened when baby was awake so had food showers were had when husband got home and could be with baby and laundry certainly did need to be done everyday so we always had clothes what has helped me and my husband get sleep is alternate feedings at night breastfeed my baby we had to use supplemental formula initially every other feeding because he had lost weight had to pump to make sure he was getting certain amount of food he has had any problems with nipple confusion because can switch between bottle and breast this may not work for you but we were lucky that he has been able to eat from both bottle and breast will pump some milk now and dad can feed baby at night allowing me to sleep longer dad will take the one feeding and ll take the other since he usually wakes up twice at night
